document_data.name: Naglatha
document_data.mainbody:
'''Naglatha''' ({{Pronounce|nahg|LATH|ah|refs=}}), alias '''the Black Flame''', was a [[Red Wizard of Thay]] residing in [[Selgaunt]] in [[Sembia]] in [[1357 DR]].
{{quote|''Make trade instead of war, how preposterous! We are the laughing stock of [[Faerûn]] when we should be the most feared. I hate this game-playing. We should embrace our past and the honest ways… killing, war, and occupation. Instead we hawk magical wares like street vendors.''|Naglatha, the Chief of Foreign Activities of Thay}}
document_data.Description: Naglatha was a young, black-haired woman with a grim face.
document_data.Personality: Naglatha quickly rose through the ranks of the Red Wizards thanks to her fanatical zeal and ruthlessness. However, she was loyally devoted to the god [[Azuth]].
document_data.Activities: Naglatha kept her devotion to [[Thay]] a secret from her associates in Selgaunt. She masqueraded as a merchant with a store that traded in magical items and curios from the South. Her shop was located on [[Larwaken Lane]].
document_data.History:
Naglatha arrived in [[Selgaunt]] early in 1357 DR with a very deep cover; even [[Alzegund]] was unaware of her identity as a Red Wizard of [[Thay]]. Everyone in the [[Dragon Reach]] area thought she was only a merchant with a preference for extravagant tools from [[south Faerûn]]. In truth, using the alias "the Black Flame", she was recruiting valorous men to Thay's cause. She always used a black mask in her mission in order to disguise her identity. Once a year she went "to the South" for three months, in truth traveling to Thay to receive new instructions.

Later she rose through the ranks thanks to the "accidental" death of [[Alzegund]] in [[1364 DR]]. In [[1373 DR]], she was involved in a plot by the [[demon lord]] [[Eltab]] against [[Szass Tam]], but the plan backfired thanks to the intervention of [[Thazienne Uskevren]] and Tam promised his vengeance against her.
